title: Speak Life's Glen Scrivener, the Cathedral Vision of Jordan Peterson: Love, Fear & the Great Romance
description:
Glen Scrivener of Speak Life podcast and Youtube channel, poet, author, filmmaker, author of Reading Between the Lines https://www.amazon.com/Reading-Between-Lines-Testament-Readings/dp/1912373564/ref=sr_1_3?crid=HJ92RYWRX0V7&dchild=1&keywords=reading+between+lines&qid=1613518601&sprefix=Reading+Between%2Caps%2C212&sr=8-3

Speak Life website: https://speaklife.org.uk

Glen's talk with Paul Vanderklay: https://youtu.be/y8LcVBFaoOI
Glen's talk with Jonathan Pageau: https://youtu.be/EvJb_QX9Atk
Glen's analysis of Jordan Peterson's statement on belief in God:
https://youtu.be/iwF98r_aocQ

Glen and I discuss the millennial question about whether God is fundamentally evil. He points out the age old debate between Epicurus (typified by Sam Harris) and the Stoics (typified by Jordan Peterson).

The link between fear and suffering. The first fear. The necessity of suffering.

We want to look good in the presence of judgment, but the healing takes place when we look bad in the presence of Love.
